results.title: Content Marketing Manager
results.description:
About Resolve

Resolve is an embedded B2B payments solution for manufacturers, distributors, and B2B businesses. Our industry-leading solution simplifies the complex workflow of net terms, B2B credit management, AR, and B2B payments. We’ve helped more than 12,000 businesses transform their B2B payments experience, stay competitive, and improve their buying experience. We are now at an exciting phase as we scale our growth. Some things we’re proud of:

  • We are the B2B spinout of Affirm (BNPL for B2B)

  • Raised $25M in Series A. Backers include Insight Partners, Initialized Capital, PayPal/Affirm co-founder Max Levchin, and other top-tier investors

  • Founders Chris and Brian are successful serial entrepreneurs and Y-Combinator alumni

  • We invest in our people and take psychological safety seriously  

 

The role

We’re looking for an experienced content creator to own and optimize the content function across the entire funnel for Resolve. This position requires experience in content strategy, short and long-form content creation, marketing campaigns, persona targeting, copywriting, and outbound messaging, as well as market, industry, and competitive research.  

As a core member of the Marketing team, you will work closely with the entire Revenue function to create compelling content to target different personas in specific industries across the manufacturing, distribution, fintech, and B2B commerce space. This will include SEO blogs, bylines, webinar content, case studies, eBooks, whitepapers, video scripts, infographics, sales enablement, ad copy, copywriting, outbound messaging, and more. You will be writing a lot of content, so you must love writing and be a superb business writer who can turn out high-quality content quickly. You must also have an eye for detail and a strong aesthetic to be able to craft on-brand, compelling content to enable the Sales and Customer Success teams with collateral and tools to close sales and ramp up customer retention and expansion. The success of the role will be measured on content performance including opportunity generation and revenue attributed to content, organic search traffic, page views, and sessions to content pages, content downloads, opens/replies/clicks for emails, and reach.

 

What you’ll do:

Growth and customer retention are the company’s top priorities. Content will play a critical role in helping us achieve these goals across the entire revenue funnel. You will…

  • Create exciting content. Lots of it. Use your stellar writing skills to create compelling short-form and long-form pieces that educate and excite our audience across various content types including whitepapers, website copy, outbound copy, SEO blog posts, case studies, advertising copy, customer emails, sales enablement content, and more.

  • We know that content is king but distribution is queen. You will also help us distribute content with goals of lead generation by owning campaigns across inbound and outbound channels including SEO, email, advertising platforms, social media, website, co-marketing partners, and more.

  • Monitor performance and own the reporting of content metrics, including recognizing trends, and reacting with new recommendations, and then executing them. 

  • Explore new channels and content formats. Have a pulse on emerging content trends and be willing to experiment. 

  • Be resourceful and find creative ways to solicit design, video, and creative resources to bring messaging to life through a variety of content formats. 

  • Collaborate with Demand Generation, Growth Marketing, Product Marketing, and Sales to develop a content roadmap that maps to strategic goals, target audiences, and across the Revenue funnel.

  • Build content production process for scale, so we can efficiently grow.

  • Collaborate on strategic plans for Resolve's growth and marketing.

  • Partner with functions across the organization, from Marketing, Sales, Customer Success, Revenue Operations, and Product to successfully launch new content across the entire funnel.

  • Maintain a deep understanding of our target audiences, buyer and influencer personas, and competitive landscape to create highly effective content and campaigns.

 

The ideal candidate is / has: 

  • Experience writing in the finance, accounting, fintech, manufacturing, distribution, or inventory space. 

  • Proven experience in creating campaign copy, website copy, video scripts, case studies, sales enablement, customer marketing materials. SEO blogs, whitepapers, product-one pagers, social media, and/or outbound emails.

  • Excellent writing and editing skills combined with speed, flexibility and attention to detail.

  • Team player who works cross-functionally with respect, efficiency and effectiveness

  • Numbers-oriented, with the ability to analyze data, ask the right questions, and come up with actionable insights from different content reporting tools including but not limited to Tableau, Salesforce, HubSpot, Unbounce, and Google Analytics.

  • Project management – the ability to balance multiple projects at once is key.

  • A growth mindset and strong accountability mentality.

  • Organized and methodical, and leans into understanding both data and people. 

  • Resourceful and results-driven.

 

Bonus points if you have experience in…

  • SEO, both technical and editorial. 

  • SEM Rush, Clearscope, Contentful, HubSpot, Salesforce, Google Analytics, and Unbounce experience!

  • A fully-remote startup environment.

  • Creating content for events (online and offline).

  • Running general marketing campaigns, end to end. 

  • Experience in landing page conversion copywriting, website copy, social media copy, or ad copy.  

  • Design or content production skillsets such as podcasts, video, editing, or graphics. 

  • Being a T-Shaped marketer. 

 

Location

Resolve is a remote-first company. This role can be located anywhere in the US and Canada. We have invested in best-in-class tools, technology, and culture to ensure our team members are able to do their best work from anywhere.

 

What we offer 

  • Strong team culture fueled by humble horsepower 

  • Fully remote & flexible work environment

  • Company retreats 2X per year

  • 100% paid healthcare/dental/vision coverage for employee (70% base coverage for dependents)

  • 401(k) plan

  • Meaningful equity options

  • Generous paid parental leave

  • Unlimited PTO

  • WFH stipend

  • Subsidy for fitness tracker 

  • Learning and Development resources

 

 Resolve is shaped by a strong respect for each other. This applies to every aspect of employment – from equitable wages, work-life balance, the freedom to be your whole self, to equal opportunities for growth and development at Resolve. We believe wholeheartedly the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. We believe strongly that we benefit from diversity and encourage applicants from underrepresented backgrounds to apply.

results.title: Senior Product Marketing Manager
results.description:
Job Description

Okteto provides a local development experience for cloud applications. In a world of ever-emerging technologies, the number of tools to manage cloud-native applications becomes more overwhelming every year. This vastly increases the cognitive load for developers, decreases their productivity and forces them to become experts in areas different from their own. With Okteto, you code locally in your favorite IDE and Okteto takes care of updating your application in your development environment to provide continuous feedback as you code. No commit, build, push, or deploy required.

We are looking for a Product Marketing Manager to help us educate users on how to get the most out of Okteto and to improve our processes. You will be the first product marketing hire and will be responsible for GTM launch process, ensuring organizational readiness, supporting sales enablement efforts, and managing projects for key deliverables.

What you'll be doing

  • Create a repeatable process for a product launch that includes all go-to-market and organizational readiness activities and deliverables

  • Project manage launches to ensure all systems are “go” and then monitor impact

  • Collaborate with teams to create compelling sales and marketing collateral as well as messaging and internal/external communications to drive adoption/conversion

  • Fully own the planning and execution of product marketing projects to support key Okteto partnerships and integrations

  • Write and/or coordinate the production of written and video content explaining the joint Okteto + partner value proposition

  • Partner with the product management team to distill key functionality and benefits into core product marketing messages

  • Collaborate with sales enablement team to help create training materials, making it easy for sales to understand our product offerings and key positioning

  • Identify and support industry third-party events

A good fit

  • You are comfortable async communication and working with a remote team across multiple timezones.

  • You have experience working on GTM for developer tooling.

  • You thrive on building process and programs from start to finish. Having a big impact on a growing company gets you excited.

  • You think outside the box when it comes to strategy and initiatives.

  • You are a polished content builder.

  • You are a strong public communicator and are comfortable being a company representative for things such as customer meetings, hosting webinars and public conversations, creating video content, etc.

Nice to have

  • Video production and editing skills.

  • Experience using design tools like Figma.

  • Experience within Cloud-native ecosystem

Joining Okteto

  • An opportunity to join an early startup made up of people passionate about developer experience and community building.

  • 100% remote from day one means we understand what it takes to foster an efficient, distributed team across international time zones.

  • $1000 office equipment stipend to get you set up for work-from-home productive success

  • Sponsored yearly company offsite - read about

  • Unlimited PTO with 3 weeks minimum encouraged, plus a full company week off in December.

  • Competitive salary and equity

  • Health, dental, and vision.

  • 401K

  • 16 weeks paid parental leave for birth, adoption and foster parents.

Base Salary starting at $150,000 depending on experience

results.title: Content Strategist, Developer Content
results.description:
Prismic is hiring an Editor to bring our content production to the next level.
 
About Prismic
 
We are building a tool for frontend developers to ship a custom website builder for their content team. Marketers can compose new pages for their site by mixing-and-matching website sections their developers have built for them.
Our developers have the freedom to choose their own stack to build these website sections and use our product alongside some pretty incredible technologies, including Next.js, Nuxt.js, Gatsby.js, and more.
We've been investing a lot of time and attention into our video content, interviewing people like Wes Bos, Guillermo Rauch (CEO of Vercel), Tim Neutkens (Maintainer of Next.js), Sebastien Chopin (creator of Nuxt.js), Matt Biilmann (CEO of Netlify), and the list goes on.
It's now time for our written content to get more attention. We are looking for an Editor who'll make our blog and site, in general, the place where developers can come to optimize everything from their careers to their tech stacks. It should be a place where developers expect to find new resources on a regular basis about a wide variety of topics, with clear and insightful reviews, and advice to help them get a better understanding of the tools that they use.
 
The opportunity
 
This is an exciting opportunity for someone who loves both words and technology. This person will have the unique opportunity to shape the broader conversation about web development and the future of digital publishing.
To be successful in this role, you must have a technical mind and a passion for content strategy. You don't need to know what CSS selector specificity is off the top of your head (for example), but you do need to be curious to find out and be able to edit an article on such technical topics for spelling, grammar, and flow.
 
The blog editor will be responsible for:
 
- Evolving and implementing a content strategy for the Prismic blog that includes SEO, social media, and metrics;
- Assisting with social media;
- Finding potential writers;
- Soliciting and commissioning articles for the Prismic blog from freelance writers;
- Helping Prismic team members from across the organization to contribute to the blog;
- Ensuring every piece of content published meets our standard of quality (free of grammar and spelling errors, well-written, helpful);
- Brainstorming ideas for the Prismic blog;
- Managing an editorial calendar;
- Occasionally writing and editing materials for other departments, such as marketing copy and job postings.
 
You're exactly what we are looking for if you...
 
- Have web development skills in Javascript, and be familiar with a framework such as React, Vue, or Svelte;
- Are interested in web development and web publishing;
- Have experience with building effective social media and SEO strategies;
- Have experience editing content and managing writers;
- Are excited about owning a challenging project and leading it to measurable success;
- Can describe systems you would use for management — whether that's kanban, spreadsheets, Gantt, or something else;
- Can describe metrics of publishing success and how to track them;
- Have opinions about spelling and grammar;
- Have ideas about how to convey the tone and voice of a brand.
- Are excited to join a collaborative team of problem-solvers.
 
And what about the job details?
 
Although our headquarters are in Paris, this position is open to fully remote work. So as long as you've got a good internet connection, we don't care where you are. Whether you work from our main office in Paris, or you are a remote employee, we’ll be working together a lot – particularly, through pairing and collaborating – and we want you to succeed!
Do you want to relocate to Paris? That's great. We're always happy to have someone new in the office, but there is no preferential treatment for candidates based on their location.
That being said, where you are based may change the offer and benefits that we can provide. We'd love to be able to give you an exhaustive list of everything that we can offer, but it's difficult until we know where you are.
Our employees in Paris benefit from healthcare, extensive paid time off, paid lunches, travel reimbursement, and a bunch of other stuff.
A key aspect of Prismic is the culture that we have developed. We have regular team gatherings, all-hands meetings where every team member can discuss any topic, and we tackle challenging problems in a collaborative way where every person’s views have value. So, no matter where you are, we will want to make you a part of that culture. You might not be able to make every team building, but we will make sure that you feel welcomed and part of a company where you can thrive and grow.
 
Get in touch
 
Not sure you meet 100% of our qualifications? Please apply anyway!
Prismic is devoted to building a team of people with different backgrounds and lifestyles.
We eagerly invite applications from people of all kinds. We don’t discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, citizenship, or any other differences. If we can do anything to provide a better interview (i.e. accommodate a disability) please do let us know.
 
With your application, please include:
 
A thoughtful cover letter/short paragraph explaining why you would enjoy working in this role and why you want to work at Prismic.
A resume or a short summary of your job history. (A link to a LinkedIn profile would be fine)
When we receive your complete application with the items above, we’ll get back to you about the next steps.

results.title: Content Marketing Manager
results.description:
Since we launched in 2019, CapIntel has been on a mission to elevate finance to build wealth for all; this means helping advisors better support their clients, so they feel at ease knowing their future is secure. We’ve mastered the client experience around investments and are working with some of the largest wealth brands in North America to modernize their sales processes with innovative Wealth Tech. CapIntel’s sales enablement platform helps enterprises bridge crucial efficiency and communication gaps by enhancing how advisors and wholesalers analyze, present, and sell investments to retail investors. CapIntel is expanding rapidly, having achieved over 750% in growth in 2021, and we’re continuing to build our team to support our transformative impact on the wealth industry.

Content Marketing Manager

You will help develop, execute, and proliferate our voice in the Market. Content is a key pillar in our marketing strategy. We’re a rapidly growing Fintech that’s bringing meaningful impact to our customers within the enterprise wealth space. This role reports to our Head of Marketing and will be responsible for content creation and content program management to grow the funnel, build trust and credibility, and help us grow the business.

If you’re someone in the financial services industry and looking to jump into Fintech. You're the person we want!

What you’ll do

  • Oversee and develop the content strategy for each buyer-type journey, developing assets where we have gaps, and tell the CapIntel brand
  • Ensure consistency in brand voice, style, and tone
  • Provide analysis around how content is driving business impact.
  • Use analytics to determine the best way to engage users, create advocacy, generate customers, and measure brand awareness
  • Execute content promotion & distribution strategies that effectively increase the consumption of CapIntel’s content, drive full funnel and deal flow with our buyers & end-users
  • Tactics include but are not limited to SEO strategy, white papers, testimonials, webinars, videos, blog posts, website/social media, emails, campaigns, and more.
  • Work with the executive, marketing, sales, client success, product, and other key teams across the company to set and execute a content roadmap to articulate internal and external key messages

Who you are and what you bring

  • 3+ years' work experience writing and producing content
  • Background in finance, technology, SaaS, or fintech is preferred
  • Impeccable writing style, attention to detail, and editing skills
  • An independent mindset and ability to execute to completion in a deadline-driven environment but also remain nimble and quickly shift project priorities as business needs fluctuate
  • A high level of organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects concurrently
  • A demonstrated understanding of SEO and a philosophy on how it lives hand-in-hand with consumable content
  • Highly proficient in Google Analytics
  • A willingness to measure what works and what doesn't, and to learn through iteration
  • You’re the people’s champ; you love working in a team setting and helping solve problems
  • Bold, gritty, and curious about all things
  • An understanding of UX writing and content design is a PLUS!

We know that what matters most is a positive attitude, a hunger to learn, and the drive to create quality work and get results. While we value experience and specific kinds of knowledge, we also know that sometimes it’s a roundabout career journey. And if you’re not sure you meet the experience requirements for this position, but you know in your gut that you’ve got what it takes to bring this role to the next level, we’d like to hear from you!

Our compensation portfolio

  • Salary: We’re proud to offer a fair, competitive, and equitable process to determining your salary that is based on your skills, knowledge, experience and internal equity. You can rest assured that we will present you our best salary offer so you don’t have to worry about playing the negotiation game.
  • Benefits: Our comprehensive benefit package is available from your first day and if something doesn’t quite meet your needs, we also offer a generous healthcare spending allowance.
  • Time away from work: We love working at CapIntel, but we also love our lives outside of work. We offer competitive vacation days, lifecare days, and company holidays and build in some flexibility too!
  • Professional growth: We thrive on building our career journeys by learning, mentoring and experiencing through our jobs, our colleagues and our leadership team. Not only do we encourage it, but we also enforce a culture that ensures we thrive, grow and evolve.
  • Belonging: We respect, appreciate and celebrate our individuality. And we know that our diverse perspectives further each other and our business along the path towards greatness. We find ways to socialize, build a sense of community (even if it is across the country!) and challenge each other to share creativity in our “safe-to-fail” environment. We’re committed to making sure you know you’re appreciated for exactly who you are.

Where we work

  • Remote first. We trust our teammates to find the work location that allows them to do their best work – remotely or in person. We’re a Canadian based, remote-first environment, with in-office collaboration zone and individual workspaces in Gatineau, QC or Halifax, NS and hubs of virtual employees in Southwestern Ontario (and a few others scattered across Canada). For this role, we do find value in our teammates being able to connect, collaborate, learn from and mentor one another in-person, so we are looking for someone who will primarily work from home but be able to commute monthly to a central location in Toronto to connect, collaborate, learn from and mentor with teammates.
  • Eastern time zone We operate in the Eastern Time Zone and trust you to manage your work responsibilities in the time that supports your teammates, feeds your ingenuity, and creates a sustainable and healthy balance with your personal life.
  • Equipment set up We’ll set you up with your choice of PC or Mac, and provide you with a $750 equipment spending account to purchase the additional equipment you need to set up your virtual space and do your best work.

How we work

These principles guide our decisions towards our common goal of success.

  • Accountability
  • Teamwork
  • Simple
  • Prioritize & Execute
  • Autonomy

What’s next

We’re actively seeking candidates for this position, and keen to see your application. If this role interests you, please submit your application no later than October 22. However, we’re keen to fill this role, so we’ll reach out and hire the candidate even before the deadline, so don’t wait until the last minute to apply!

Equity, diversity and accessibility

CapIntel believes that all dimensions of diversity are a strength, and that we have a role to play in actively reducing and eliminating systemic barriers to employment equity. We believe in equal employment opportunities regardless of race, ethnicity, language, genetic information, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, family and marital status, neurodivergence, national origin, and age. We cultivate an inclusive workplace where people excel based on personal merit, qualification, experience, ability, and job performance.

If you require an accommodation that will reduce a barrier to your application, please send an email to accessibility@capintel.com and our Talent & Employee Experience teammates will work with you on options to ensure you are set up for success.

results.title: Paid Social Strategist
results.description:
DYODE is an industry-recognized eCommerce agency focused on web development, UX design, strategic consulting, digital marketing, merchandising and more located in Southern California! We are a team that leads with results, works hard and strives for excellence. Founded by two former heads of eCommerce and staffed with over 40 industry veterans, we are motivated, ambitious and continually growing to join forces with some of the biggest brands out there like Tom Brady, Jessica Simpson, Nicks Ice Cream, Bandai Namco Entertainment and Invisalign; just to name a few!

At DYODE, we are the anti-agency! Working at DYODE means joining an eCommerce solutions-based company with over 20+ years of experience. We strive for an inclusive culture by seizing every opportunity, by providing flexible work schedules for our staff, creating open community culture, streamlining our operations and implementing new strategies to drive your experience at DYODE to be the best ever! Your success is our success. What are you WAITING for?

Requirements

WHAT YOU’LL DO…

We value endless growth and learning, a team mentality, discipline and a positive attitude. The ideal candidate would possess:

  • 3-5+ years of established experience in ecommerce space which would include 2+ year of established experience in paid social media. Plus – agency & client experience.
  • Be DYODE’s paid social expert on Facebook Ads / Instagram Ads / Pinterest Ads / Snap Ads / TikTok Ads / LinkedIn Ads / etc.
  • Generate, support and grow Facebook campaigns across multiple accounts while meeting rigorous return on advertising goals.
  • Multi-task and manage multiple client accounts seamlessly with constricted timelines and DYODE’s work cadence.
  • Influence your understanding of how Paid Social channels impact overall client media mix and directly/indirectly influence top-level business objectives of clients.
  • Stay up-to-speed on most recent updates from Paid Social ad platforms and implication on clients (policies, insights, restrictions) and changes within the platform to be voice within the agency account teams.
  • Drive creation of new ad creatives both through your own concepts as well as collaboration with other departments.
  • Leverage understanding of how all Social Media platform algorithm works and implication of how this impacts different buying models in relation to client business objectives.
  • Develop/improve processes for campaign setup & communication. Bring new campaign and tactical execution ideas and opportunities and report on campaign performance to internal team and clients.
  • Monitor, report, perform analysis, pace and monitoring of all assigned campaigns; adjust if needed to remain in budget parameters. Understand data analysis of campaign performance metrics to develop optimization from all angles.

WHAT YOU’LL NEED…

We want you to succeed in this position and will help coach you in refining your skills. The ideal candidate would possess:

  • Strong conceptual thinking. We want our team to be able to start projects off from an incredibly strong position and come up with unforeseen, clever concepts to move forward with. A deep level of care about the quality of your work and how it reflects on your character is the DYODE way.
  • Strong self-management practices with meticulous attention to detail. Be able to deliver a solid approach to consistent, development ready work.
  • Honesty, Integrity & Fairness. Respect for individual ability, creativity and diversity.
  • A natural inclination to be pro-active and take the lead in solving problems as you find them. A hunger for personal and professional growth.
  • Strong communication skills (both written and verbal), discretion, professional openness, and other leadership skills needed to coordinate and facilitate healthy, well-organized teamwork.
  • Having a sense of humor and being witty isn’t a bad thing either! Having enjoyment of work and life balance is key here at DYODE!

Benefits

  • Remote First Company with Option to Work Remotely from Anywhere OR Be in Our Really Cool Office Space
  • Have Flexible Working Hours
  • Competitive Salary. Exceptional Health, Dental, Vision & Life Insurance
  • Traditional 401K
  • PTO for Paternity & Maternity Leave
  • Flexible PTO, Sick Days and Personal Days Given
  • Exceptional Co-workers & Management
  • Free Lunches. Birthday & Anniversary Staff Appreciation Days
  • Amazing Company Outings (Lakers, Dodgers, Angels, Disneyland, Breweries etc) & Themed Holiday Parties
  • Professional Development Offered & Performance Reviews
  • Education Stipend
  • Laid Back Work Environment
  • New Apple Gear (ex: Macbook Pro)
  • We’re even a Dog Office!

*Get Amazing DYODE Merchandise & Company Perks on US! What’s there NOT to love?*

results.title: Head of Content
results.description:
We’re Craze — a full-stack agency that tackles all things marketing and growth for our clients. We’re a nimble team that excels at ongoing marketing management that builds business and meets any challenge clients throw at us. That includes strategy, content creation and execution, social media management, copywriting, SEO, paid ads, and business development. Like we said, any challenge.

Our content needs have expanded over the last year, and we’re currently hiring our very first content lead. We’re producing an increasing amount of content in-house, and we’d like a dedicated employee to take charge of our content production by ensuring quality and consistency across everything we produce. We already work with a number of fantastic content writers, so you’ll be well-supported in producing content — but you’ll be leading and growing our content department over the coming months.

Content lead responsibilities:

  • Lead a team of freelance/contract writers in producing a range of short and long-form content, including social media captions, video scripts, blog posts, e-books, case studies, decks, and website copy. You’ll also contribute to content production as necessary.
  • Liaise with other Craze team members and clients to strategize around short- and long-term content needs and set a direction for any content pieces.
  • Build and manage a team of freelancers and any future team members, including writers and editors, as our content operations expand.
  • Proofread and edit content produced across channels.
  • Provide editorial and creative support to Craze team members.
  • Lead Craze’s own content marketing efforts.

Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in communications, journalism, English or related field.
  • 3-4 years agency experience or in a similar role.
  • Adept at keyword placement and SEO best practices.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Proficiency with popular content management systems.
  • Experience with social media management.
  • Creativity and the ability to develop original content.
  • Ability to develop content that provokes engagement.
  • Strong leadership qualities.

Benefits

  • Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
  • Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
  • Work From Home
  • Free Food & Snacks
  • Stock Option Plan

results.title: Product Marketing Lead
results.description:
Find your magic with us

Connecting people to their family stories is special. We're proud to deliver these magic moments. Through technology, data and insights, we bring people closer to their past, to benefit their future.

We’re a fast-growing team of smart people, on a mission to help millions. Solve meaningful, complex problems and be a part of something magical. Enjoy the agility of a scale-up with the security of real financial backing, in a place where every story matters.

Why join our brand team?

1. We’re driven by the desire to create a fantastic customer experience

2. We love nothing more than taking big data and making it quick and easy for our consumers to digest

3. We’re naturally collaborative and our cross functional teams work closely with our colleagues to build / enhance our product

4. We’re neatly set up for flexible working and giving people the freedom to thrive.

You won’t find any bureaucracy here, but you will find:

  • Generous holiday allowance with the chance to buy more
  • A pension contribution that stands out in the market (9.5% matched company contribution with a 6% contribution from the employee's side).
  • All the health and wellbeing benefits you’d expect and some you wouldn’t (Careers Page)
  • The chance to work with smart and fun people on products that will bring joy to millions.

We value seeing each other in person from time to time. It helps us do great work. We ask our employees to attend one of our office hubs in London or Dundee once a quarter and meet for company offsites twice a year, so we can spend valuable time together working collaboratively.

Requirements

About the Role

Product Marketing Lead

You’ll be responsible for communicating the value of Findmypast’s product experience. You will develop tools and campaigns that ensure Findmypast customers can discover value at every step of their product journey and are kept up to date on our product evolution.

The role has a broad scope and will see you delving into a diverse range of areas to produce engaging proposition and content – you’ll be thirsty for insight and a problem solver who loves nothing more than the challenge of meeting the customer needs with each product launch. You’ll deeply understand the needs of the customers and you’re an expert at crafting those needs into winning propositions.

You’ll be a brilliant planner, collaborator, and communicator, who works to ensure all teams build and develop features that you can take to market. You’ll be a key driver and lynchpin, working closely with the Product team to ensure each product release is communicated in a way that delivers value for our customers and drives growth for our business. You’ll own the Go To Market Strategy for all product releases and be responsible for communicating these benefits to customers, industry analysts, the media, and the public.

Responsibilities

  • Collaborative : Work with the Product Management Teams and Brand Teams to define product positioning, messaging, and marketing programmes that support the product launch processes. You’ll craft product marketing propositions and unique selling points that set the product apart from the rest in the market.
  • Strategy: Go to Market– you’ll plan and take to market all new products / propositions / services and data within the company
    • Content Creation: Work with the brand content teams to deliver materials that support Go To Market campaigns, customer programmes, and most importantly, the launch processes; This may also requires working with agencies.
    • Sales enablement: use your market and product knowledge to help growth and campaign teams align their marketing process to the way the market wants to buy - collaborate with relevant teams (customer Engagement, Growth, Brand teams re: product and launch updates.
    • Cross-functional working: Develop strong relationships and collaborate closely with key stakeholders, both internally and externally, ensuring regular communication across the business.
    • Launch: plan, execute and measure the effectiveness of go-to-market strategy.
    • Ensuring briefing the press, PR teams, CS teams on new products and services to be launched in the market
    • Agreeing on timelines and deadlines of new product development with the product management teams to drive the best revenue and customer success outcomes.
  • Results driven: Deliver and achieve, clear and tangible business objectives for each product releases.
  • Insight Led: Competitor market/product research discovering insights and trends in the market. Be the voice of the market by augmenting our own concepts with market research & competitor analysis. You’ll be able to articulate how Findmypast differentiates from other solutions.
  • Communicator: You’ll be communicating the vision and the brand relevance of the product launch to the wider company and ensure the value of new products to relevant teams
  • Customer driven: Working with CX to ensure interviews and focus groups for obtaining relevant insights about the customer’s product usage and buyer personas to tap new opportunities

About you:

  • You have a growth mindset

results.title: Account Director, Sinch for Marketing
results.description:
Sinch is a global leader in the growing market for Communication Platforms as a Service (CPaaS) and mobile customer engagement. We are specialists in allowing businesses to reach everyone on the planet, in seconds or less, through mobile messaging, email, voice, and video.

More than 150,000 businesses, including many of the world’s largest companies and mobile operators, use Sinch’s advanced technology platform to engage with their customers. Moreover, Sinch has been profitable and fast-growing since its foundation in 2008.

Sinch's core values are Make it Happen, Dream Big, Keep it Simple and Win Together. These values describe how our global organization works and inspire every of our more than 3,000 employees across 55 different countries.

Sinch is organized into five business units: Applications, Enterprise & Messaging, Voice, Developer & Email, and SMB. This role will be under Applications.

The Applications team is responsible for delivering innovative solutions through conversational platforms and next-generation communication channels like WhatsApp, Instagram, Telegram, Apple Business Chat, Line, Kakao Talk, and other telecommunications channels like SMS, MMS, and RCS.

The essence of the role.

Sinch is looking for a Strategic Account Director to join the Client Services Team. Strategic Account Directors function as a trusted client partner by developing a strong understanding of our clients' business objectives and by identifying opportunities to meet those objectives with a mix of technology and professional services. As part of the Client Services team, you will drive account expansion while remaining engaged in delivery to ensure our customers become fans. This role reports to the VP, Client Services.

In this role, you will:

  • Lead and direct a set of accounts ensuring team health, quality of delivery, high client satisfaction, profitability, and financial growth.
  • Work closely with Account Managers and CSMs who will maintain their own direct client relationships.
  • Be measured by client satisfaction and account growth according to set targets.
  • Work across a variety of technologies – including those providing SMS, MMS, conversational messaging, digital advertising, email marketing, and other CRM solutions.
  • Practice strong habits around account planning, forecasting and business reviews. Organize and present information that has a strong narrative.
  • Cultivate strong relationships with your clients and proactively look to expand those relationships. Plan and strategize at a senior level. Able to uncover pain points and opportunities.
  • Collaborate closely with others in the Client Services team including Strategists, Account Managers, Creatives, and Project Managers.

Requirements

  • 10+ year’s experience managing high-performing accounts and teams with demonstrated growth.
  • Experience with CRM, mobile marketing campaigns and/or working in context of mobile messaging channels.
  • Awareness of or experience with the process of creative development and production.
  • A strong communicator able to organize and present information in a compelling way. Effective team management skills.
  • Highly motivated with a strong desire to achieve client satisfaction and account growth.

Benefits

Sinch is a global company composed of people from different countries and cultures. Our benefits adjust regionally to support employees and help them to thrive in every stage of life. We offer valuable benefits and resources, including health and life insurance, a flexible work environment, retirement savings plans, and more.

Our Hiring Process.

In Sinch, we are committed to following a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and non-discriminatory. Our Talent Acquisition team, together with hiring managers and the rest of the interviewing team, persistently work towards identifying the candidates that best fit each open job, based on Sinch’ s hiring needs and candidates’ career expectations.

We encourage applications from strong candidates with relevant professional backgrounds for this role. Not all applicants will meet all job requirements exactly! Even if you do not meet all job requirements, don't let that stop you from considering Sinch for the next step in your career. We are always open to candidates that could bring new ideas and perspectives to Sinch!

results.title: Growth Lead - BitNetwork
results.description:
Context

Windranger is a product lab working on the BitDAO ecosystem. You can read more about us here. Over the next few years, BitDAO intends to secure a handful of large partnerships (on the scale of zkSync, Game7, BitNetwork).

As proposed by one of BitDAO’s core contributors, BitDAO is looking to build a chain (BITNetwork) that: uses $BIT as a native token; is EVM compatible; and optimized for high throughput dapps such as derivatives dexes and gaming.


Your Role

  • Business development and partnership lead to engage partner applications and tools in the BitNetwork ecosystem, across all verticals such as gaming, defi, art, social, sports, etc.

  • Formulate builder oriented narratives

  • Strategize and execute key partnership deals whilst advising partners on industry trends and best practices

  • Identify features and tools required for web2 to web3 user onboarding, game engine integration, financial institution adoptions for the engineering team to implement

  • Align internal resources to support the integration and onboarding of new partners

     

Your Craft

  • 5+ years in business development, ecosystem partnership or growth roles

  • Experience working in a variety of technology first sectors such as defi, blockchain, gaming, social media etc...

  • Ability to build and grow a high performing business development / growth team

  • Knowledge of web3 gaming, social preferred
